Authors:
Maria Jesus Cano, Juan Antonio Jimenez, Juan Francisco
Jimenez
Title:
A systematic revision of the genus Erythrophyllopsis
(Pottiaceae, Bryophyta).
Abstract:
New taxonomic data are provided in the genus
Erythrophyllopsis, after a taxonomic revision. Two species are
recognized: E. andina and E. zanderi sp. nov. Barbula fuscula,
Erythrophyllopsis boliviana, Glyphomitrium ferrugineum, Tortula
semivaginata, and Trichostomum juniperinum are synonymized with E.
andina. Erythrophyllopsis zanderi includes ZanderÂ´s (1993) concept of
Erythrophyllastrum andinum. Lectotypes for Barbula fuscula,
Erythrophyllopsis boliviana, Trichostomum juniperinum and, Tortula
semivaginata are here proposed. A new key, detailed descriptions,
illustrations and a distribution map are provided. Maximum parsimony and
Bayesian analyses of chloroplast DNA sequences (trnL-trnF region and and
trnG intron) suggest that Erythrophyllopsis could be paraphyletic, with
respect to the genus Bryoerythrophyllum. A denser sampling and the use
of other phylogenetic markers are required to better understand the
generic and suprageneric relationships of Erythrophyllopsis.
